document_data.name: Piki Bread
document_data.mainbody: '''Piki''' was a variety of [[bread]] made from [[corn]]meal by the [[Azuposi]] [[human]]s of the [[Pasocada Basin]] in [[Maztica]].
document_data.Description: Piki bread was a staple of Azuposi diet, an alternative to [[tortilla]]. Unlike tortilla, piki was made of thin watery corn batter layers, individually fried on blistering hot rocks, then layered and folded, and cooked further.
